Question_1.Context: Researchers improved the electrical conductivities of Carbon-Fiber-PEEK composites by nanomaterial functionalization.
Question_1.Question: How did the addition of graphene in the interlayers affect the electrical properties of Carbon-Fiber-PEEK composites?
Question_1.B: Had no effect on the electrical properties
Question_1.C: Increased the transverse electrical properties significantly
Question_1.D: Increased the in-plane electrical properties slightly
Question_1.Source: Adding only a few wt% graphene in the interlayers of structural CF-PEEK composites by this technique led to more than 60% increase in transverse electrical properties, and much more in plane.

Question_2.Context: A study focused on improving the longitudinal electrical conductivity of structural composites.
Question_2.Question: How was the longitudinal electrical conductivity of structural composites improved?
Question_2.B: By tufting conductive fibers into the braided structure
Question_2.Source: The through-thickness conductivity was achieved by tufting conductive fibers into the braided fibrous structure, bringing both functional and structural benefits for through thickness properties.

Question_3.Context: A study investigated the through-thickness mechanical strength of flax fiber reinforced green bio composites.
Question_3.Question: How was the through-thickness mechanical strength of flax fiber reinforced green bio composites improved?
Question_3.Source: The tufting technology was used to improve the through-thickness mechanical strength of flax fiber reinforced green bio composites, using glass fibers.

Question_4.Context: A study focused on the fusion welding of thermoset to thermoplastic polymer composites.
Question_4.Question: What was used to ensure chemical compatibility in the fusion welding of dissimilar materials?
Question_4.Source: This point is illustrated for the fusion welding of thermoset to thermoplastic polymer composites. The thermoset side needs to be functionalized through co-curing with a thin thermoplastic interlayer.

Question_5.Context: A study monitored the structural health of polymer composites using carbon fiber rovings.
Question_5.Question: How is crack formation monitored in polymer composites?
Question_5.Source: It was shown that the capacitance decrease is highly correlated to the crack formation, as the permittivity of air gaps is lower than that of the composite.

Question_6.Context: A study focused on developing more reliable magnetic sensors.
Question_6.Question: How were more reliable magnetic sensors developed?
Question_6.A: By bonding permanent magnets to metal substrates
Question_6.C: By embedding the sensors in polymer composites
Question_6.Source: The authors show that it is possible to develop more reliable sensors by torsional ultrasonic welding of the magnets to stainless steel substrates.

Question_7.Context: A study analyzed the mechanical and hygroscopic properties of thermoformed Chemi-Thermo-Mechanical Pulp.
Question_7.Question: What was the key focus of the analysis on Chemi-Thermo-Mechanical Pulp?
Question_7.Source: These functional properties are key for packaging applications. Results showed that a careful optimization of the process parameters led to a lower water uptake of the material.

Question_8.Context: A study investigated the impact of solar radiation on cellulose-based humidity-sensing material.
Question_8.Question: What type of shape changes can be induced in cellulose Cottonid based on the study?
Question_8.Source: Application-oriented adaptive elements based on cellulose Cottonid capable of complex, passive, moisture-induced shape changes with adjustable amplitude.

Question_9.Context: A study examined the effects of temperature and humidity on curing cold mix asphalts.
Question_9.Question: How do warm and dry temperatures affect the mechanical performance of cold mix asphalts?
Question_9.A: Decrease stiffness and aging of the binder material
Question_9.B: Increase stiffness and aging of the binder material
Question_9.C: Have no effect on the mechanical properties
Question_9.Source: Results of the presented study showed that warm and dry temperatures tend to increase the material stiffness as well as the aging of the binder material.

Question_10.Context: A study focused on the development of sensors adapted to various applications.
Question_10.Question: What was the focus of the study on the development of sensors?
Question_10.Source: The structural health of polymer composites was monitored by inserting carbon fiber rovings into glass non-crimp fabrics.
